_comment: Created by EFisher on 12/10/2015 14:33:32 using v2.7
title: How has the proportion of inpatients warned of danger signals on discharge changed?
analysis_commentary: The proportion of inpatients who reported not being warned of danger signals upon returning home has decreased from 39% of surveyed patients in 2002 to 35% in 2014. However, in the latest year of data, 56% of patients were not completely warned about danger signals to watch out for when they went home and is an area for potential improvement.
data_source: Care Quality Commission, Survey of Adult Inpatients
